extDescription.message: Advanced content filter for YouTube Music, YouTube and SoundCloud

msgPlatformDisabled.message: Extension disabled for this platform. Enable it in settings.

errorYearRange.message: Minimum year must be less than maximum

errorDurationRange.message: Minimum duration must be less than maximum

optionsPlatformsDescription.message: Enable or disable the extension for specific platforms.

optionsInterfaceDescription.message: Customize the visual appearance of MetaGroove.

warningYTM.message: EXPERIMENTAL - WARNING! This is experimental and should not be enabled because Youtube can ghostban your Youtube channel

optionsApiKeyDescription.message: MetaGroove uses free HTML fetch to extract video dates from YouTube.com. You can configure a YouTube API key for a more reliable fallback in case of rate limiting.

optionsApiKeyPlaceholder.message: Enter your YouTube Data API v3 key

optionsCacheDescription.message: The cache stores publication dates of already fetched videos to speed up filtering and avoid repeated network requests.

optionsCacheAutoClean.message: Cache automatically clears after 7 days for each video

optionsConfirmRemoveApiKey.message:
Do you really want to remove the API key?

The extension will only use free HTML fetch.

optionsConfirmClearCache.message:
Do you really want to clear all video date cache?

This will force re-fetch of all dates on next visit.

aboutTagline.message: Advanced Music Filtering for YouTube, YouTube Music & SoundCloud

aboutWhatP1.message: MetaGroove is a free and open-source browser extension that adds advanced and parameterizable filters to major music streaming platforms.

aboutWhatP2.message: It allows filtering music content on YouTube, YouTube Music and SoundCloud based on criteria such as:

aboutWhatLi4.message: Exploration Mode (YouTube): Filters suggestions to show only related videos, removing algorithmic noise.

aboutUniqueFeatureBox.message: ‚ö° Unique Feature: MetaGroove can extract release dates directly from YouTube.com, making the year filter work even on YouTube Music where this info is normally not visible.

aboutHowStep1Text.message: Go to a supported platform (YouTube, YouTube Music or SoundCloud) and click the MetaGroove icon in the browser extension bar.

aboutHowStep2Text.message: In the popup, check the boxes of the filters you want to use:

aboutHowStep2Li1.message: Release Year: Set minimum and maximum year

aboutHowStep2Li2.message: Track Duration: Use sliders to choose min/max duration

aboutHowStep3Text.message: After configuring filters, click the "Apply Filters" button.

aboutWarningText.message: After clicking "Apply Filters", the page will reload automatically. DO NOT CLOSE THE PAGE and WAIT for MetaGroove to:

aboutWarningLi1.message: Automatically scroll the page to load all available content

aboutWarningLi2.message: Extract info (title, artist, year, duration) from each track

aboutWarningLi3.message: Apply filters and hide non-matching tracks

aboutProcessingTime.message: ‚è≥ Processing time: From a few seconds (small playlists) up to 1-2 minutes (channels with hundreds of videos). Check browser console (F12) for logs.

aboutHowStep4Text.message: Tracks that DO NOT match filter criteria will be automatically hidden, leaving only those that satisfy all active filters.

aboutTip.message: üí° Tip: To see ALL tracks again, disable filters in popup and click "Apply Filters" or manually reload the page (F5).

aboutWhyGrid1Text.message: Find specific era tracks for thematic mixes (e.g. "only 90s house music")

aboutWhyGrid2Text.message: Analyze genre evolution filtering by year and keywords

aboutWhyGrid3Text.message: Filter too long/short tracks or find only remix/live versions

aboutWhyGrid4Text.message: Create thematic playlists filtering by multiple combined criteria

aboutCreatedText1.message: MetaGroove was born from the frustration of not being able to effectively filter music content on popular streaming platforms.

aboutCreatedText2.message: Platforms like YouTube and SoundCloud provide millions of tracks, but their search interfaces are limited and lack advanced filters for key parameters like year or duration.

aboutCreatedText3.message: This makes it impossible for DJs, researchers, and music lovers to easily find specific content without manually scrolling through hundreds of results.

aboutMissionBox.message: üéØ Mission: Give control back to users allowing them to filter, organize and discover music by their own criteria, without depending on platform algorithms.

aboutCreatorText.message: MetaGroove is an open-source project developed and maintained by TX-Breaker.

aboutContributeText.message: Contributions, feedback and bug reports are welcome! Visit the GitHub repository to contribute.

aboutLicenseText.message: MetaGroove is released under MIT License, which allows:

aboutDisclaimerBoxText.message:
MetaGroove is a completely independent tool that:
  • DOES NOT have any affiliation with YouTube, Google, SoundCloud or other platforms
  • IS NOT sponsored, endorsed or approved by these platforms
  • Operates entirely client-side (in your browser)
  • DOES NOT collect, store or transmit personal data

aboutPrivacyText.message: Privacy: MetaGroove does not track user activity and does not collect analytics data. All filtering happens locally.

aboutTosText.message: Terms of Service: Using MetaGroove does not violate supported platforms' ToS as it only hides elements already present on the page without modifying content or bypassing protection measures.

aboutSupportText.message: To report bugs, request features or get support:

aboutSupportLi1.message: üêõ Bug Report: Open an issue on GitHub Issues

aboutSupportLi2.message: üí° Feature Request: Propose new features via GitHub

aboutSupportLi3.message: üìñ Documentation: Read the README on GitHub
